description.narrative:
The Kiribati Disability Support Program initiative aligns with the Development for All 2015-2020: Strategy for Strengthening Disability Inclusive Development in Australia's Aid Program. The 2015 Kiribati Census confirmed that 14% of the total population in Kiribati has some form of disability. The KSCCSN is the only existing institution that provides education for children with special needs.
This investment will focus on the delivery of a multi-year program of support to the Kiribati School and Centre for Children with Special Needs (KSCCSN). The objective of the investment is to ensure: i) ongoing operation and delivery of quality inclusive education; ii) children’s access to the school on a daily basis; and ii) support mainstreaming initiatives.
The estimated value for this investment is $1.1 million over 3 years, commencing 1 February 2019 – 31 January 2022.
